intro: Triantha, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to North America, particularly the western United States. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. They produce clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in the spring. Triantha species are often found in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and streambanks.
